question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Disk Space Exhaustion] Can an attacker trigger repeated save_config calls with large configurations to fill disk space, causing validator node failures and loss of liveness? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: override_config_mut()] [Consensus Parameter Injection] Can override_config_mut at lines 114-116 be used to inject malicious consensus parameters (round timeout = 0, quorum size = 1) that break AptosBFT safety guarantees or allow single-validator block commits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Validator Set Manipulation] Can the configuration override mechanism be exploited to inject unauthorized validators into the validator set configuration, allowing Byzantine nodes to participate in consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: base_config_mut()] [Base Config Poisoning] Can base_config_mut at lines 122-124 be exploited to modify the base configuration after construction, causing incorrect diff calculations that hide malicious config changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Network Config Injection] Can malicious network configurations (peer discovery, RPC endpoints, connection limits) be injected through overrides to enable network partition attacks or Sybil attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Persistent Config Backdoor] Can an attacker use save_config to persistently store malicious configuration overrides that survive node restarts, maintaining long-term compromise of validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Safety Rule Bypass] Can configuration overrides disable or weaken safety rules (double-sign prevention, voting constraints) in the consensus layer, allowing validators to equivocate? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Gas Parameter Manipulation] Can gas-related configuration parameters (max gas per block, gas price multipliers) be overridden to create consensus divergence where validators disagree on valid transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: override_config()] [Immutable Config Bypass] Does the read-only getter at lines 110-112 properly prevent config tampering, or can Rust interior mutability patterns (RefCell, Cell) bypass this and allow unauthorized modifications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: override_config_mut()] [Concurrent Modification] Can concurrent access to override_config_mut from multiple threads cause race conditions where config reads see partially updated state, leading to consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [TOCTOU in Diff] Between reading override_config (line 127) and base_config (line 128), can concurrent modifications cause inconsistent diffs that hide or expose incorrect configuration changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Concurrent Save Race] Can multiple threads calling save_config simultaneously cause file corruption, lost writes, or inconsistent YAML output that breaks validator startup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Concurrent Load Race] If load_config is called while another thread is modifying the file system, can this lead to partial reads, corrupted deserialization, or validator crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Struct: OverrideNodeConfig] [Send/Sync Safety] Is OverrideNodeConfig properly marked as Send/Sync, and are there any interior mutability patterns that could cause data races when shared across threads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: base_config_mut()] [Mutation During Diff] Can base_config_mut be called while get_yaml is executing, causing the diff calculation to use inconsistent base values and produce incorrect results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Diff Inconsistency] At lines 20-32, can the order of keys in the Mapping affect the diff result, causing non-deterministic configuration outputs across different validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Missing Key Detection] When a key exists in base_mapping but not in override_mapping, is this properly detected as a deletion, or does it silently use the base value creating config inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Sequence Diff Limitation] At lines 63-68, sequence comparison is all-or-nothing - can this hide partial modifications in arrays (like validator list changes) that should be detected and flagged? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Number Precision Loss] At lines 49-54, when comparing Number values, can floating-point precision issues cause semantically equal values to appear different, creating unnecessary config diffs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Nested Null Handling] If nested objects become Null, does the recursion at line 24 properly handle this transition, or can it cause unexpected diff outputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Empty Diff Default] At lines 129-131, when diff_yaml is None, an empty Mapping is returned - can this be confused with an explicitly empty config, causing validation bypass? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Clone Performance] The clone() calls at line 14 could be expensive for large configs - can this be exploited for DoS by providing extremely large nested structures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Serialization Error Handling] At lines 143-147, if serde_yaml::to_string fails, is the error message safely constructed without leaking sensitive configuration data in the error string? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Deserialization Type Safety] Does NodeConfig::load_config perform strict type validation, or can malicious YAML with wrong types be partially deserialized causing undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Roundtrip Consistency] If a config is saved with save_config and then loaded with load_config, is it guaranteed to be semantically identical, or can serialization artifacts cause config drift? (Medium)
